Description: A wooden model of a funereal barge, conveying a sarcophagus to the tomb; mourners, sailors and priests on board, engaged in making offerings and preparing the mummy; mummies with the heads of the protective deities, the four sons of Horus, Imseti (human), Hapi (baboon), Duamutef (jackal) and Qebehsenuef (falcon) below; illustration to Pettigrew's "A History of Egyptian Mummies and an Acount of the Worship and Embalming of the Sacred Animals by the Egyptians" (1834) Etching
Bibliographic references: Reid 1871 / A descriptive catalogue of the works of George Cruikshank (1624)
Associated titles: A History of Egyptian Mummies and an Acount of the Worship and Embalming of the Sacred Animals by the Egyptians
